visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render an area chart with the following specifications: Chart type: area, Chart title: 'stacking: normal, connectNulls: false', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for the title and labels, with a font size of 14px for the title and 12px for the labels, Data series: Two series with data [1, 1, null, 1, 1, 1] and [1, 1, 1, null, 1, 1], Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue (#A7D8FF) to dark blue (#005A9C) for the first series and from light green (#B8E986) to dark green (#2E7D32) for the second series, Additional configurations: Set the chart background to white, add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render an area chart with specific styling and data series. The chart type is set to 'area', and the title is styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The axes labels are also styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 12px. The data series include two areas with data points that include null values, and the stacking is set to 'normal'. Custom colors are applied to each series using linear gradients, with light blue to dark blue for the first series and light green to dark green for the second series. The chart background is set to white, and a legend is added at the bottom of the chart. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to ensure adequate spacing around the chart.
